alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 3:26PM EDT until June 29 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Maine, including the following county, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and creeks, water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 326 PM EDT, state highway department reported flooding in Rockwood due to heavy rain and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Rockwood and vicinity is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Taunton And Raynham Academy Grant, Misery Gore, Sapling, Tomhegan, Rockwood Strip, Sandwich Academy Grant, Misery and Indian Stream.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
